Welcome to share secrets’s documentation!¶

API¶

GET /suspicious¶

Get suspicious requests by link id

Query Parameters:
 
  • id (string) – link id
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type – application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – link created
Return:
Response JSON Object:
 
  • texts (List[string]) – list of decrypted

** Example request **

curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/?id=d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808&key=barOPQQMrz7iGJ6yVmXwqpFNXCu1jOckZD0xWq6pWt8%3D

** Example response **

[
    {
        "action": "get",
        "link_id": "d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808",
        "remote_ip": "172.19.0.1",
        "status": "failed",
        "timestamp": "2018-10-13T14:36:13.234842"
    },
    {
        "action": "get",
        "link_id": "d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808",
        "remote_ip": "172.19.0.1",
        "status": "failed",
        "timestamp": "2018-10-13T14:36:15.880436"
    }
]
POST /¶

Encrypt text

Request Headers:
 
  • Accept – application/json
Request JSON Object:
 
  • texts (List[string]) – list of texts to encrypt
  • ttl (int) – time to live for returned link in seconds
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type – application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – link created
  • 400 Bad Request – malformed request
Return:
Response JSON Object:
 
  • link (string) – link to decrypt text
  • link_id (string) – link id, can be used for querying suspicious requests

** Example request **

curl -X POST http://localhost:8080/ -H 'Content-Type: application/json'                 -d '{"texts": ["password1", "password2", "password3"]}'

** Example response **

{
    "link": "http://localhost:8080/?id=d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808&key=barOPQQMrz7iGJ6yVmXwqpFNXCu1jOckZD0xWq6pWt8%3D",
    "link_id": "d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808"
}
GET /¶

Get decrypted text

Query Parameters:
 
  • id (string) – link id
  • key (string) – encryption key
Response Headers:
 
  • Content-Type – application/json
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – ok
  • 404 Not Found – link not found
Return:
Response JSON Object:
 
  • texts (List[string]) – list of decrypted texts

** Example request **

curl -X GET http://localhost:8080/?id=d19f7bff-83ee-4374-88c5-09e98db44808&key=barOPQQMrz7iGJ6yVmXwqpFNXCu1jOckZD0xWq6pWt8%3D

** Example response **

{"texts": ["password1", "password2", "password3"]}
